variants.Description in input context: G2019S and I2020T have approximately 2-fold lower and 6-fold higher ATP affinity, respectively, than wild-type LRRK2.
G2019S and I2020T have approximately 2-fold lower and 6-fold higher ATP affinity, respectively, than wild-type LRRK2.

Material used.Description: ATP affinity was measured using recombinant LRRK2 protein expressed in HEK293 cells.

Readout description.Result Description: G2019S shows 2-fold lower ATP affinity compared to wild-type LRRK2.
I2020T shows 6-fold higher ATP affinity compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed in each experiment.

Technical replicates.Description: Each protein sample was tested in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: A protein sample without ATP was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare ATP affinities between variants and wild-type.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: ATP binding affinity within 1.5-fold of wild-type values.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: ATP binding affinity below 0.5-fold of wild-type values.
